title: Implement configurable detection rules for micro-transaction patterns
summary: Develop a flexible detection framework that allows for the configuration of rules specifically targeting micro-transaction behaviors. This system should empower fraud analysts to define and adjust detection logic to capture evolving fraud patterns involving transactions under $1.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: configurable rules (based on transaction frequency, merchant type, device, customer, and time)

title: Support rule customization by transaction frequency, merchant type, and time of day
summary: Allow users to customize detection rules by key transaction parameters such as frequency, merchant type, and time windows. This enhancement aims to provide targeted fraud pattern identification by fine-tuning detection logic to known threat behaviors.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: configurable rules (based on transaction frequency, merchant type, device, customer, and time)

title: Detect suspicious micro-transaction activity per customer or device in 24-hour window
summary: Implement analytics to monitor customer and device activity for micro-transactions over 24-hour periods. The system should raise alerts when suspicious activity patterns or thresholds are detected per entity in a rolling daily window.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: system must support configurable rules (based on transaction frequency, merchant type, device, customer, and time)

title: Generate real-time alerts to Fraud Operations via Slack, email, and dashboard widget
summary: Configure the system to provide instant notifications to Fraud Operations using multiple channels, including Slack, email, and internal dashboards. This ensures timely awareness and rapid response to fraud events as they are detected.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: triggering real-time alerts to the Fraud Operations team via Slack, email, and dashboard upon suspicious detection

title: Include transaction, customer, merchant, and triggered rule details in alerts
summary: Ensure every alert contains comprehensive context including transaction specifics, customer and merchant identities, plus the rule that triggered the alert. This level of detail supports rapid fraud assessment and investigation by operational teams.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Alerts require contextual transaction, customer, merchant, and triggered rule details.

title: Log false positives and use data to refine detection rules continuously
summary: Track and record every false positive, using the insights from logged events to enhance and tune detection rules. This feedback cycle enables continuous improvement in fraud detection accuracy and reduces operational noise.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: false positives (e.g., app store micropayments, donations) must be logged for rule refinement

title: Rate-limit notifications per customer to prevent alert spam
summary: Apply per-customer rate limiting to alert notifications, minimizing the risk of excessive alerting and improving user and operator experience. This guards against alert floods which can desensitize responders and obscure true fraud incidents.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Prevent alert flooding by rate-limiting per customer.

title: Maintain logs of triggered alerts, investigations, and outcomes for audit
summary: Create persistent logs for all triggered alerts, subsequent investigations, and their outcomes. These logs are essential for auditability, supporting oversight requirements and external reviews.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: all alerts, investigations, and outcomes audited

title: Provide periodic summary reports for compliance and risk review
summary: Develop automated summary reports summarizing system activity and key fraud detection statistics. These reports are essential for compliance audits and help risk managers periodically review fraud controls and incidents.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Periodic summary reports should be generated for compliance/risk review.

title: Ensure sensitive customer data is excluded from alert payloads beyond investigation need
summary: Implement strict data handling in alert payloads so that only investigative-relevant information is included, excluding unnecessary sensitive customer data. This reduces privacy risk and supports regulatory compliance for customer data protection.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Enforce privacy by limiting sensitive data exposure in alerts.
